meanings.definition: Consisting of or combining two parts or elements.
meanings.sent1: The diplex puzzle required matching pairs of shapes.
meanings.sent2: The diplex flower had both red and yellow petals.
meanings.sent3: The diplex cake had two layers of different flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her diplex personality showed both kindness and determination.
meanings.sent5: The diplex key opened two different locks.

meanings.definition: A device that allows two signals to be transmitted simultaneously over a single channel.
meanings.sent1: The diplex machine enabled the transmission of voice and data together.
meanings.sent2: The diplex system improved the efficiency of communication.
meanings.sent3: The diplex gadget made the technician's job easier.
meanings.sent4: With the diplex device, the radio station could broadcast music and news at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The diplex invention revolutionized the way signals were sent.
